sentence: 1 |||  ||| 0.1 ||| Aims To investigate the effects of exercise training (ET) on left ventricular (LV) volumes, cardiopulmonary functional capacity and N-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide (NT-proBNP) levels in postinfarction patients with moderate LV dysfunction.
content: postinfarction patients with moderate LV dysfunction
label: pr.Disease

sentence: 17 ||| Study population ||| 3.3 ||| Eighty-one consecutive patients immediately after acute ST elevation MI were screened for inclusion into the study.
label: po.Size

sentence: 18 ||| Study population ||| 3.4 ||| We excluded patients with residual myocardial ischemia, severe ventricular arrhythmias, atrio-ventricular block, valvular disease requiring surgery, pericarditis, and severe renal dysfunction (i.e.
content: residual myocardial ischemia, severe ventricular arrhythmias, atrio-ventricular block, valvular disease requiring surgery, pericarditis, and severe renal dysfunction
label: po.Disease

sentence: 30 ||| Study design ||| 4.11 ||| Group T patients were enroled in a 6 month exercise-based Cardiac Rehabilitation programme, whereas group C patients were discharged with generic instructions to maintaining physical activity and a correct lifestyle, and were seen only at 6 months.
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 27 ||| Study design ||| 4.8 ||| At entry and at 6 month follow-up, all patients underwent Doppler-echocardiography and cardiopulmonary exercise test, and completed a questionnaire for evaluation of leisure time physical activity [18].
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 3 |||  ||| 0.3 ||| NT-proBNP assay, Doppler-echocardiography and cardiopulmonary exercise test were performed upon enrolment and at sixth months.
content: NT-proBNP assay, Doppler-echocardiography and cardiopulmonary exercise test
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 61 ||| Results ||| 6.17 ||| All patients underwent an incremental cardiopulmonary exercise on a bicycle ergometer with a ramp protocol of 15 W/min continued until exhaustion.
content: an incremental cardiopulmonary exercise on a bicycle ergometer
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 63 ||| Results ||| 6.19 ||| In both groups, ET was associated with a fall in NT-proBNP, but 6 month NT-proBNP plasma levels were higher in group C compared with group T patients.
content: ET was associated with a fall in NT-proBNP
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 68 ||| Results ||| 6.24 ||| At each level of baseline NT-proBNP plasma levels, 6 month LVEDVI changes were lower in group T compared with group C patients (Fig.
content: 6 month LVEDVI changes were lower in group T compared with group C patients
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 94 ||| Discussion ||| 7.17 ||| In conclusion, 6 month ET early after MI in patients with moderate LV systolic dysfunction induces a reverse LV remodelling correlated with a significant reduction in NT-proBNP plasma levels, and an improvement in functional capacity, LVEF and early LV diastolic filling.
content: a significant reduction in NT-proBNP plasma levels
label: o.Treatment
